It was a bittersweet experience for parents and staff as they waved off four bus loads of students, staff, volunteers, and luggage. For some students, this was their first experience away from home. Students were able to get outdoors for real hands-on learning about a variety of topics in support of science standards.

We are so grateful for being able to give our students an action-packed, week-long learning experience at La Honda for Science Camp because we love providing different ways for students to learn, engage and explore.

A special thanks to the Ravenswood Education Foundation (REF) for coordinating donations so that all students had a sleeping bag and warm coat, if needed. Any leftover coats and sleeping bags will be used for the upcoming 7th grade trips to Yosemite.

Dear Ravenswood Community:

As you are aware, our nation experienced another school shooting this morning. This time, it happened here in our home state of California. In moments such as these, I understand the stress and trauma many of us feel about the safety of our schools after learning a school has been targeted.

I want you to know that we work each and every day to ensure the safety and wellness of our students, teachers, and staff. Our district has many safety procedures in place, including a strong relationship with our police department.

Many of you may be getting questions from your children regarding today’s tragedy. If you need support, please let us know. We are here for you.

Lastly, let’s remember the importance of working together to keep our communities safe. Always report suspicious activities. Make sure to keep your emergency contact information up to date. Stay connected with us on social media for the latest information.

In community spirit,

Gina Sudaria
Interim Superintendent

The RCSD family is extremely saddened by the recent loss of Lepaga Tito. Lepaga contributed and dedicated many years to our district and will be truly missed by everyone.

Thank you, Lepaga, for all your years of service to Ravenswood students and families:

2000-2002 Secretary II
2002-2009 Program Specialist
2009-2010 Instructional Aide at the Ravenswood Child Development Center
2010-2012 Administrative Secretary for Curriculum & Instruction
2012-2013 Administrative Secretary for Brentwood Academy
2013-2016 Administrative Secretary for Curriculum & Instruction
2016-2018 Confidential Secretary for Curriculum & Instruction

For those who would like to attend his services, you may find the information below:

Family Service- Thursday, September 26th at 5:00 PM
Burial Service- Friday, September 27th at 11 AM

Both services will be held at:

The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
875 Quince Ave.
Santa Clara, CA 95051

Lepaga Tito - October 20, 1969-September 8, 2019
